2017/2018球季意甲賽程：

常見問題：
AC米蘭同國際米蘭又係有"米蘭"，應該點分？
ANS：AC米蘭簡稱米蘭，國際米蘭叫國米，避免稱呼做AC，因為AC係球會咁解，而milan先係名既簡稱。
AC米蘭仲係咪「老人院」？
ANS：現時全隊平均年齡為25歲。
今個轉會窗到目前為止簽咗咁多球員，遲啲仲會唔會有錢買人？
ANS：其實買球員好少會一炮過畀，多數都係分期，所以仲會有錢簽其他球員。
簽咗咁多球員會唔會過唔到FFP？
ANS：早前米蘭管理層有同UEFA探討經營計劃。
http://sempremilan.com/ts-fassone-meets-uefa-to-discuss-ac-milan-business-plan（By 二石四鳥)

Bonucci: My advice to Milan…


Leonardo Bonucci has urged Milan’s board ‘to buy top international players’ this summer as they would also ‘raise the level in training’.

There is much intrigue as to what Milan will do in the upcoming transfer market, amidst doubts over the viability of their ownership.

Nonetheless, the defender - a €40m arrival from Juventus last year - told Calciomercato.com: “Mirabelli and Fassone don’t need advice.

“If I had to give them some, I’d tell them to buy top international players. By doing so, the level in training also rises. It’s crucial.”

‘Lazio & Milan want Ozyakup’

Oguzhan Ozyakup’s agent has claimed that Lazio and Milan want the Besiktas midfielder, who will make a decision on his future ‘within the next two weeks’.

Ozyakup is being touted as the next Super Lig winner team to leave Besiktas this summer after Cenk Tosun, and his representative suggested the 25-year-old could be Serie A-bound.

“I can confirm that Lazio, Marseille, Everton, Milan and Valencia are all watching Oguzhan and are interested in him,” he told the Liverpool Echo, reports Tuttomercatoweb.

“We’ll make a decision on his future within the next two weeks.”

Ozyakup was born in Netherlands but has represented Turkey on 30 occasions, including at Euro 2016, is a product of Arsenal’s youth system.

Milan want Vidal, Depay

Milan are reportedly interested in both Arturo Vidal and Memphis Depay, but it will depend on their Financial Fair Play settlement.

The Rossoneri saw a voluntary agreement rejected by UEFA, so they’ll have FFP sanctions imposed ahead of next season.

As a result, the club’s hierarchy have been moving for free transfers, with Pepe Reina, Ivan Strinic and Ki Sung-Yueng all linked with Bosman moves.

According to today’s edition of Tuttosport though, the Diavolo also have two bigger names in mind, starting with Bayern Munich midfielder Vidal.

The newspaper believes that he will ask to leave the German club in the summer, one year before the end of his contract.

That could see his transfer fee reduced, but Milan will struggle to pay his wages if they’re hit with a heavy FFP sanction.

The second big name target is Memphis Depay, with the Lyon winger calling the Rossoneri “a great club and a great team with a great history”.

However, Manchester United have a buyback option on the Dutch international and could challenge Milan for his signature.

"The impossible things might become possible if you believe, and I still believe.

"I don't think we were lucky,"

"I am pleased for my players as they played an excellent game against a great opponent. We deserved something else.

"We had a perfect tactical order in the first half creating some good chances. It was a pity to concede, as despite it did not demoralise us, we did lose our dynamic. Bayern had plenty of the ball but were not dangerous."

"In the second half it was even but we did not have enough power to counterattack. In the last ten minutes we came forward proudly and I liked it.

"It was a pity to concede two goals through two deflections."

AC Milan players will wear a black armband when they face Inter in the derby at the San Siro on 4 April as a tribute to Ray Wilkins.

The former Rossoneri midfielder suffered a cardiac arrest on 31 March and was taken to St George's Hospital in London. He was in an induced coma at the south London hospital and died at the age of 61 on Wednesday.

To commemorate the former England international, Milan will wear a black armband when they take on the pitch to face Inter on Wednesday. Wilkins played for the Italian outfit for three years, between 1984 and 1987.

replies.msg: 用咗個嘔樣

Kalinic was not bad, he was average. To put him in the same category as Jack, who had a terrible game, is just absurd.

Frankly, Cutrone wasn't particularly better than Kalinic. He was completely outmuscled by the CBs all game long, something which is a frequent problem with him, and Inter didn't even have to use both CBs to handle him, making it harder for the other attacking players to find space. His runs were correctly blown for offside, and he was a bit sloppy on the ball. The good parts were his work rate, like usual, with defensive runs and high pressing, and the spectacular finish when he was offside. He was average.

Was Kalinic particularly good? No, but Inter struggled a lot more with his physicality, like we saw in that one situation where he created a chance for Suso (and frankly it was very risky by Inter to manhandle him that roughly inside the area). He lost the ball a few times, but I'm not sure what he was suppose to do because he was very isolated up front when getting the ball, we didn't move the team up to help him at all. His work rate is nothing like Cutrone, but he did run and try to pressure together with Borini when the rest of the team didn't have the energy to help force an error.

quote.msg:
Kalinic was not bad, he was average. To put him in the same category as Jack, who had a terrible game, is just absurd.

Frankly, Cutrone wasn't particularly better than Kalinic. He was completely outmuscled by the CBs all game long, something which is a frequent problem with him, and Inter didn't even have to use both CBs to handle him, making it harder for the other attacking players to find space. His runs were correctly blown for offside, and he was a bit sloppy on the ball. The good parts were his work rate, like usual, with defensive runs and high pressing, and the spectacular finish when he was offside. He was average.

Was Kalinic particularly good? No, but Inter struggled a lot more with his physicality, like we saw in that one situation where he created a chance for Suso (and frankly it was very risky by Inter to manhandle him that roughly inside the area). He lost the ball a few times, but I'm not sure what he was suppose to do because he was very isolated up front when getting the ball, we didn't move the team up to help him at all. His work rate is nothing like Cutrone, but he did run and try to pressure together with Borini when the rest of the team didn't have the energy to help force an error.

Milan want Callejon?

It’s reported Milan are interested in Napoli’s Jose Callejon, and they could offer Suso in exchange.

The Rossoneri will almost certainly sign Pepe Reina on a free transfer when his Partenopei contract expires, with reports the Spaniard has already done a medical.

According to Il Mattino, Reina is not the only Napoli player the Diavolo are interested in, as they’re also keen on Callejon.

The two players share an agent, Manuel Garcia Quilon, and during the talks for Reina there was also a discussion about his compatriot.

Callejon would cost around €35m, but Milan are considering offering Suso to Napoli to try and lower the cost.

It's also expected that Milan will keep track of Florian Thauvin, even though he will not play for Marseille tonight. The 25-year-old Frenchman is known for his ability on the right wing, but can ultimately play on both sides. Should Suso leave Milan this summer, then Thauvin could be the perfect replacement, as his price most likely is within the region of Suso's release clause (€40m).
